intro: Ottleya utahensis, commonly known as the Utah ottleya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Ottleya utahensis is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert habitats.
